thread.title: Nurse charged with stealing painkillers from elderly patients - Local news
thread.title_full: Nurse charged with stealing painkillers from elderly patients - Local news

author: boston.com
title: Nurse charged with stealing painkillers from elderly patients - Local news
text:
Hingham Police have charged a nurse at Queen Anne’s Nursing Home with swapping elderly patients’ painkillers with Tylenol, water, and mouthwash, according to The Patriot Ledger .
Cindy L. Martin, 35, was arrested Saturday in Quincy. She was dismissed from her job as a licensed practical nurse at the nursing home in June after the drugs were discovered. The patients she stole from were age 71, 77, and 82.
Related Link Get today’s headlines right in your inbox “These are people who needed this medication and may not have been able to communicate that they are in pain,” Hingham Police spokesman Sgt. Steven Dearth told the Ledger .
 Martin is charged with three counts of assault and battery, multiple counts of drug possession, and one count of drug larceny. Police claim she stole morphine, oxycodone and vicodin, according to the Ledger .
Read the full story in the Ledger .
FBI’s 10 most wanted :
 Alexis Flores was allegedly involved in the kidnapping and murder of a 5-year-old girl in Philadelphia in 2000. The young girl was found strangled to death in an apartment. Reward: up to $100,000. Photo courtesy of the FBI Victor Manuel Gerena has been on the list longer than the current fugitives. He is connected to a 1983 robbery of $7 million from a security company in Connecticut, where he allegedly took two employees hostage at gunpoint. Reward: up to $1 million. Photo courtesy of the FBI Jason Derek Brown is being sought for allegedly shooting and killing an armored car guard outside a movie theater in Phoenix, Arizona in 2004. He then allegedly fled with thousands of dollars. Brown may possess a Glock 9mm and a .45 caliber handgun. Reward: up to $200,000. Photo courtesy of the FBI Yaser Abdel Said is wanted for the alleged involvement in the murders of his two teenage daughters in Irving, Texas. He is known to conceal his identity by wearing dark sunglasses and changing his physical features. Reward: up to $100,000. Photo courtesy of the FBI Fidel Urbina is wanted for alleged aggrevated sexual assault and murder, both crimes he committed in Chicago. He allegedly beat and raped a woman in 1998, and allegedly beat, raped, and strangled a second woman to death late in 1998 while out on bond. Reward: up to $100,000. Photo courtesy of the FBI Eduardo Ravelo is the head of Barrio Azteca, a Mexican-American gang whose members have committed several murders and act as hitmen for a drug cartel. He is wanted for racketeering and drug-related charges, and he is believed to have altered his fingerprints and had plastic surgery. Reward: up to $100,000. Photo courtesy of the FBI William Bradford Bishop is the oldest fugitive on the list. He allegedly bludgeoned his wife, mother, and three sons to death in Bethesda, Maryland, in 1976, and then allegedly buried and burned the bodies in Columbia, North Carolina. Reward: up to $100,000. Photo courtesy of the FBI Glen Stewart Godwin has fled prison twice. He served part of his sentence for murder in California’s Folsom State Prison and fled in 1987. Later that year he was imprisoned for drug trafficking in Mexico and escaped months after allegedly murdering an inmate. Reward: up to $100,000. Photo courtesy of the FBI Robert William Fisher is being sought after allegedly killing his wife and two children and then blowing up their Scottsdale, Arizona home in 2001. Reward: up to $100,000. Photo courtesy of the FBI Semion Mogilevich allegedly headed and authorized a 1990s multi-million dollar scheme to defraud investors in the stock of a public company in Canada (with headquarters in the Newtown, Pa.). The scheme ended in 1998 when thousands of investors lost $150 million. Reward: up to $100,000. Photo courtesy of the FBI
